subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I know that whatever God does is final. Nothing can be added to it or taken from it. God's purpose is this that people should fear Him. (Ec. 3:14)
reflection: So what is the purpose of life? It is that we should fear the all-powerful God. To FEAR God means to respect and stand in awe of Him because of who He is. 'Purpose' in life starts with whom we know, NOT with what we know or how good we are. It is IMPOSSIBLE to fulfill our God-given purpose UNLESS we revere God and give Him first place in our life.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You that everything was created by You with a purpose. I pray that you will forgive me for not living accordingly. I pray that You will forgive me for living selfishly and not thinking about the needs of others. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I also noticed that throughout the world there is evil in the courtroom, Yes even the courts of law are corrupt! (Ec. 3:16)
reflection: I don't thing I have to remind you of this fact that there is evil and corruption in the place where there should be justice. It even affects the legal system. Solomon asked how God's plan can be perfect when there is so much injustice and oppression in the world (4:1). He concluded that God does not ignore injustice but will bring it to an end at His appointed time (12:13, 14).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, we are seeing so much evil in our day. Because of this, there are people who find it easy to not believe in You. Help us remember that this life is not all there is, so please forgive us when we pass judgment on You, because we do not know everything. Your plan is to live with You forever, so help us to give thanks always. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: In due season God will judge everyone, both good and bad, for all their deeds. (Ec. 3:17)
reflection: Although God does not punish us immediately for our sins, His eventual judgment is certain. We do not know exactly when it will happen, but we know that no one will escape the final encounter with the Creator.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, as I deal with the problems of this life, I pray that Your Holy Spirit will guide me in my faith so that I will never drift from my faith in You. Amen.

verse: I realize that God allows people to continue in their sinful ways so He can test them. That way, they can see for themselves that they are no better than animals. (Ec. 3:18)
reflection: Solomon makes an observance of mankind that is very judgmental, when he says mankind is no better then animals. But what do we hear and see when watching the news. Remember Scripture tells we were created as rational beings, BUT MANY have lost their true rationality, and so many are living irrationally, opposed to the righteousness of God.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be mindful of the path You want me to follow, I pray this in the name of Jesus Christ. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Solomon said "I saw that there is nothing better for people than to be happy in their work. That is why they are here! No one will bring them back from death to enjoy life in the future. "
reflection: Independent of God's revelation, we cannot know the future. Even when we are called into the majesty of heaven, it is unlikely that we shall see what is after us, but in the midst of eternal blessedness, would we really care?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, we have not kept Your Law as we should. We continually sin and fear death. We know through Your Holy Gospel by faith that all Your merits are ours freely through Christ. Death cannot harm us, for it will be swallowed up in victory. Praise be to You, O Lord. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Solomon says; "Then I observed that most people are motivated to success by their envy of their neighbors. But this, too, is meaningless, like chasing the wind". . (Ec. 4:4)
reflection: The answer IS to work hard but with moderation. Take time to enjoy the other gifts God has given, and realize that it is God who gives out the assignments and the rewards, not us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always keep my focus on Your plan for me that is provided in Scriptures. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: It is better to be a poor but wise youth then to be an old and foolish king who refuses all advise. (Ec. 4:13)
reflection: Advancement or getting to the top is meaningless. Position, popularity, and prestige are poor goals for a life's work. Although many seek them, they are shadows without substance. How much better to seek God's approval. His love never changes.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my goal in life would always meet with Your approval. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (The importance of fearing God) So when your make a promise to God, don't delay in following through, for God takes no pleasure in fools. Keep all the promises you make to Him. (Ec. 5:4)
reflection: Solomon warns his readers about making foolish promises to God. In Israelite culture, making vows was a serious matter. It is foolish to make a vow you cannot keep or to play games with God by only partially fulfilling your vow. (Pro. 20:25) It is better NOT TO vow than to make a vow to God and break it. If you make a vow keep it. (Mt. 5:33ff)
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for hearing my prayers, help me to remember the seriousness of making promises that I cannot keep Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: THE FUTURE DETERMINED AND UNKNOWN: Everything has already been decided. It was known long ago what each person would be. So there is no use arguing what each person would be. So there is no use arguing with God about your destine. (Ec. 5:10)
reflection: God knows and directs everything that happens, and He is in complete control over our lives, even though at times it may not seem like it. How foolish it is for us to contend with our Creator, who knows us completely, and can see the future. SEE (Ro. 9:19-23)
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for being in control even though at times it seems hard to believe it. I pray that You will forgive me for sometimes doubting You. . . Amen.
